Call 519-258-6111 for Non-Emergencies requiring police attendance. To speak with an officer call 519-255-6700 Police Headquarters 150 Goyeau Street P.O. Box 60 Windsor, ON N9A 6J5 519-255-6700 Amherstburg Detachment 532 Sandwich Street South Amherstburg, ON N9V 3R2 519-736-8559 Email: info@windsorpolice.ca Please note: Email is not used for reporting crimes. Email to this mailbox is for information purposes and is not a police report. ** NOTE ** Email should NOT be used for reporting crimes, requesting Police attendance or Freedom of Information requests. If you know the specific area to which you would like to direct your email, please indicate this in the subject line. He is a founding Board Member of WLP and has been a governor in Windsor schools for over 20 years. He is a current member of Royal Borough of Windsor & Maidenhead Schools Appeal panel and lives locally with four school age children. Tony Evans Tony is an entrepreneur and facilitator who cares deeply about the creation of a stronger, fairer and more sustainable society. As the founder of EGI Live he helps organisations around the world to build engaged teams, deliver transformation & create strong cultures. Tony is also a founder of TripShift, a sustainable technology platform aiming to shape the future of carbon measurement as a cornerstone of tackling climate change. He is a Fellow of the RSA and an Anthropist. Through the board of the Windsor Learning Partnership, he shares the responsibility for a safe and fulfilling learning & life experience for every one of the 3000 children aged 3 -18 in our 6 schools.Â  Tony was a governor of The Windsor Boys School from 2013 -23 and a founding trustee of WLP.Â  He is chair of the Audit & Risk committee. David Oliver - Chair of Trustees David has been a Trustee of WLP since the Trust was founded in 2015. He became Chair of the Trust in 2024, having previously chaired the Audit and Risk Committee. He was a Governor of the Windsor Boys School between 2013 and 2024. David now works as an independent business advisor and executive coach, having retired as a partner in a major professional services firm in 2018. David lives in Windsor and is married with three adult children, two of whom attended schools that are now part of WLP. Andrew Try AndrewÂ is Founder and CEO of ComXo a leading provider of outsourced business services and technologies to support the modern hybrid workforce. AndrewÂ is passionate about education and his local community and is a governor of Berkshire College of Agriculture and Governor to leading boys prep school, Papplewick .Â AndrewÂ is trustee of The Windsor Festival, Chairman of The Royal Windsor Rose and Horticultural Society, Chairman of The Harcourt Trust, trustee of The Prince Philip Trust and a Deputy Lieutenant of The Royal County of Berkshire. Liz Herod Liz retired in 2016 as Principal of a Slough Primary School, an academy in the Park Federation Academy Trust. She continues to be a Trust Member of this MAT and also a Governor in two of their academyâ€™s as well as a Maidenhead school. Wholly committed to supporting education as it enters another period of change and challenge, Liz is very pleased to be asked to join WLP, and will work to make a positive contribution. She has a son and daughter who both went through the Windsor school system and has lived in Windsor for more than forty years. Mary Davies After leaving university, Mary worked at the Bank of England. She left to embark on trilingual Masters in International Business (in French, German and English). She stayed in France, working for a tour operator in Aix-en-Provence before returning to the UK to start teacher training. She took up her first modern languages teaching post in Staffordshire in 1995. Until recently, Mary was the Chief Executive OfficerÂ of Maiden Erlegh Trust in Berkshire. Under her leadership, the trust grew into a strong family of three secondaries, one primary, one special and 1 AP, with an all-through special and another secondary free school due to open in 2023. Mary is currently a school-trust improvement partner. She works with trusts and school leaders across the country, coaches on the National Professional Qualification: Executive Leadership and is an Ofsted inspector. She has provided training and spoken at conferences on a range of themes including curriculum, provision for disadvantaged pupils, school improvement planning and developing middle leaders or governors. Maryâ€™s values are those of ambitious inclusion and creating an opportunity-rich environment for pupils and staff alike. In a small way, she helps leaders create and maintain the positive school culture which is right for the pupils and staff in their schools. As a result, outcomes for pupils improve, inspections and external reviews are positive, professional development and working culture is valued and communication is effective. Peter Collins Peter is Headteacher at Slough and Eton CofE Business and Enterprise College and has been there since 2017, having previously been a Headteacher in Hampshire.Â  He is also Director of Secondary Education for the Trust his school is in, SEBMAT. Peter started his career as a Music teacher and was a Head of Year before becoming a senior leader.Â  He has two children of secondary school age and lives in Berkshire . Natasha Ramsden Natasha joined the board of trustees in 2025. She is a doctor specialising in paediatrics and has worked in multiple hospitals in the Thames Valley region during her paediatric training. She lives in Windsor and has three young children, the oldest of whom attends a school which is part of the Windsor Learning Partnership. In her free time she enjoys attending a local church, running and swimming . Nikki Craig - Vice Chair of Trustees Nikki joined the Windsor Learning Partnership in February 2025.Â  She is a governor at Windsor Girls School and was previously a governor at Dedworth Green First School for 14 years and Dedworth Middle School for a year.Â  She is a Human Resources professional by qualification and works in the public sector as a director of HR, Corporate Projects, IT and digital.Â  She lives locally and her children attended schools in the Windsor Learning Partnership, her youngest is currently at Windsor Boys School.Â  One of her children also attended the local authorityâ€™s special school so she also has extensive personal experience of SEND and is passionate about inclusion and success for all. G avin Henderson - CEO of WLP Gavin co-founded the Windsor Learning Partnership in 2015 and was on the board of Trustees for the first phase of its growth supporting his colleague as CEO. Since becoming CEO himself in 2020, as well as supporting schools during the pandemic he has focused on expansion and structures, collaboration between schools, modernisation, and school improvement across a three-tier local school system. Windsor Learning Partnership now has six schools and a SEN resource base and will continue to expand. Jatinder Matharu Jatinder is a safeguarding professional with 25 yearsâ€™ experience playing a pivotal role in shaping systemic safeguarding improvements, ensuring compliance and effectiveness. Leading with professional curiosity, compassion and ethically to support and transform lives by eliminating barriers young people encounter while navigating their lives both in person and online. Jatinder began her career in childrenâ€™s social care and the safeguarding board in Slough. She later supported 57 educational settings as an Education Safeguarding Professional before advancing to a senior leadership role. Jatinder has three children, one of whom attended Windsor Boys School, and she currently resides in Maidenhead. In June 2025, Jatinder joined the Windsor Learning Partnership as the Safeguarding Trustee. She also serves as a subject matter expert for two other local schools in the capacity of Safeguarding Trustee. â€‹ Victoria Stott - Lead Governance Professional Victoria joined the Windsor Learning Partnership in November 2024 as Lead Governance Professional. Formerly a civil servant with expertise in policy and governance, she has experience working with regulated sectors including higher education, and leading a ministerial private office in the House of Commons. Victoria enjoys long walks in Windsor Great Park and chairing the PTA at her sonâ€™s school. Windsor Learning Partnership: a company limited by guarantee Registered in England: Company Number: 9409109 Registered Office: Windsor Girlsâ€™ School, Imperial Road, Windsor, Berkshire, SL4 3RT Tel: 01753 795155 | Email: enquiries@windsorlearningpartnership.org Site Map Policies Accessibility Statement Cookie Information Website Policy High Visibility Mode Full Media Mode All website content Â© Windsor Learning Partnership Website design by PrimarySite Top Cookies Unfortunately not the ones with chocolate chips. Our cookies ensure you get the best experience on our website. Please make your choice! Reject all Accept all Customise cookie settings Cookies Some cookies are necessary in order to make this website function correctly. These are set by default and whilst you can block or delete them by changing your browser settings, some functionality such as being able to log in to the website will not work if you do this. The necessary cookies set on this website are as follows: Website CMS A 'sessionid' token is required for logging in to the website and a 'crfstoken' token is used to prevent cross site request forgery. An 'alertDismissed' token is used to prevent certain alerts from re-appearing if they have been dismissed. An 'awsUploads' object is used to facilitate file uploads. Matomo We use Matomo cookies to improve the website performance by capturing information such as browser and device types. The data from this cookie is anonymised. reCaptcha Cookies are used to help distinguish between humans and bots on contact forms on this website. Cookie notice A cookie is used to store your cookie preferences for this website. Cookies that are not necessary to make the website work, but which enable additional functionality, can also be set. By default these cookies are disabled, but you can choose to enable them below: Reject all Accept all Save

Follow Discover all 9 employees Report this company About us Windsor Rugby Club is an established Community Amateur Rugby Club based at Home Park next to Windsor Castle. 

Our 1st XV, winners of the Wadworth 6X Southern Counties North League 2018/19, currently play in a competitive South-West 1 East Division.

In addition to our 1st XV we have a Womenâ€™s section (Winners of the National Junior Plate â€™16 & â€™17), further 3 senior menâ€™s teams, a thriving Youth & Minis section developing players  from the age of 6 onwards. 

#WeAreWindsor #OneClub ğŸŸ¢ğŸ”´ğŸŸ âš«ï¸ Website http://windsorrfc.rfu.club/ External link for Windsor Rugby Club Industry Spectator Sports Company size 11-50 employees Headquarters Windsor, Berkshire Type Nonprofit Founded 1987 Specialties Sports, Events, Sponsorship, and Business Networking Locations Primary Home Park, Datchet Road Windsor, Berkshire SL4 6HX, GB Get directions Employees at Windsor Rugby Club Sophie Naish Commercial Marketing Executive at Ufit Protein Ollie Brown Sports Rehabilitator working in sport and privately Windsor Rugby Club Sports Specialist at Windsor Rugby Club Louis Taylor See all employees Updates Windsor Rugby Club 428 followers 18h Report this post WINDSOR RFC is Game On! 

Fabulous start to the season as we officially kicked off our cluster with Hungerford and Thatcham to form the Berkshire Warriors 

We are super thrilled to be part of this great initiative to ensure our u14s and u16s can continue with competitive cup and league games while our three clubs can focus on growing the girl's sections in their areas. 

We welcomed the u12s, u14s and u16s players, coaches and parents yesterday to Home Park for our first training session and to map out the season ahead. 

Becs Curley, head of girls at Windsor RFC, said: "So much hard work has gone in to making this happen and to provide the best opportunity for our Damsels. We are thrilled to be joining Hungerford and Thatcham for the HOB cup and league games and I can't wait to see the Berkshire Warriors in action.

"A huge thank you to everyone from the coaches, the parents and most importantly the players for being supportive of this venture. Everyone has given up a lot of time to get this going and we really do appreciate it."

If you have been inspired by the England Rugby Red Roses Rugby in the Rugby World Cup then come down to Windsor Rugby Club and join the fun

Windsor Rugby Club kicked off the 2025/26 season in style with the launch of a brand-newÂ Coaching Forum, bringing together coaches and volunteers from across the clubâ€™s age groups. The first session, held last week, was well attended with representatives from multiple age groups in attendance. 

The forum was designed to provide a platform for coaches of all levels to share ideas, strengthen standards, and ensure alignment across the youth section. The evening covered a structured agenda that reflected both the governance and the culture of the club:
â€¢ Youth Rugby / Governance OverviewÂ â€“ ensuring that all coaches and volunteers, including those new to rugby, are familiar with the framework that underpins the clubâ€™s youth programme.
â€¢ Coachesâ€™ CharterÂ â€“ reaffirming the shared values and expectations for coaches across all age groups.
â€¢ Coaching RequirementsÂ â€“ outlining mandatory qualifications and checks, including GMS registration, DBS clearance, safeguarding and refereeing courses, plus a call for aÂ season-long coaching coordinatorÂ to support the network.
â€¢ Coach of the Year AwardÂ â€“ the introduction of an annual award to celebrate the outstanding commitment and contributions of individual coaches.
â€¢ Future Forum DatesÂ â€“ agreement on timings for mid-season and end-of-season gatherings.
â€¢ Q&A and Open DiscussionÂ â€“ giving coaches from different age groups the chance to exchange ideas and strengthen collaboration.

Any questions or queries please contact our events team at: email events@windsorrugbyclub.com ğŸŸ¢ğŸ”´ğŸŸ âš«ï¸ #WINDSORRUGBYCLUB #WRFC #WEAREWINDSOR #ONECLUB #HOMEPARK #RFU #RUGBY #JOINWINDSORRUGBY #NEWPLAYERSWELCOME #SUPPORTYOURLOCALCLUB #NETWORKINGEVENT #GRASSROOTS #GRASSROOTSRUGBY #BERKSHIRERFC #BERKSHIRERUGBY 5 Like Comment Share Windsor Rugby Club 428 followers 5d Report this post WRFC: Weekly Round Up & This Weekends activities 6TH & 7TH September: The start of the 2025/2026 season starts with a Double Header this Saturday!
 
Despite well documented challenges that the club has had with the pitches after the long hot dry summer, the club is delighted that despite only having one full sized playing pitch available the season is kicking off this weekend.
 
The Senior Women have a friendly on Saturday (6th September 2025) against Teddington RFC Ladies followed by the Senior Menâ€™s 1st XV League match against Teddington RFC. There will also be a pre-match league lunch with Windsor RFCâ€™s Colts sponsors attending. Again, many thanks to Grundonâ€™s for their continued support of Windsor RFC.
 
In addition the U13s will be presented their club ties to mark their transition from Minis to Juniors.
 
On Sunday there is a full programme of Minis and Junior rugby with all age groups returning to training.
 
This weekendâ€™s schedule:
 
Saturday 6th September 2025:
 
â€¢	Windsor Dames vs Teddington Women RFC ( Friendly ) Pitch 4 â€“ Kick Off 1.30pm.
 
â€¢	Windsor Menâ€™s 1st XV vs Teddington RFC ( Regional Thames 2 League) â€“ Kick Off 3.00pm.
 
 
Sunday 7th September 2025:
 
â€¢	U6 to U12 - Training 9:30 to 11.00am
 
â€¢	U13 to Colts - Training 11:30 to 1.00pm
 
WOMENâ€™S RUGBY WORLD CUP â€“ LETS GET BEHIND THE ENGLISH ROSES AND CHEER THEM ON IN THEIR QUEST TO WIN THE WORLD CUP ON HOME SOIL!
 
This Saturday the club will be showing the England vs Australia match â€“ Kick Off 5.00pm
 
Please come down to the club and watch the Senior Men and Women and then cheer on the English Roses to make it a great start to the new season!

Windsor RFC hope that you have all been enjoying the summer and down time away from Windsor RFC.
 
The 2025/2026 season getting closer and the Senior Men and Women as well as the Junior Boys and Girls have been busy getting ready for the new season.
 
The Club does have some challenges with Home Park as ground conditions are very poor.
 
A further announcement on the state of Home Park will be made in due course.
 
This weekend the Menâ€™s 1st XV have a pre-season game at Home Park against the Coldstream Guards. This match will take place on Pitch 4 towards Datchet.
Kick Off 2.00pm.
 
The Menâ€™s 1st XV and the Senior Women have away pre- season fixtures on the 22nd August and 30th August, with the Men being away at Chiswick and the Senior Women away at Camberley.
 
 
WOMENâ€™S RUGBY WORLD CUP â€“ LETS GET BEHIND THE ENGLISH ROSES AND CHEER THEM ON IN THEIR QUEST TO WIN THE WORLD CUP ON HOME SOIL!
 
With the Womenâ€™s World Cup about to start, Windsor RFC will be showing Englandâ€™s Pool Matches in the clubhouse;
 
â€¢	Friday 22nd August 2025 England vs USA  -Kick Off 7.30pm.
 
â€¢	Saturday 30th August 2025 England vs Samoa  - Kick Off 5.00pm.
 
â€¢	Saturday 6th September 2025 England vs Australia â€“ Kick Off 5.00pm.
 
The schedule for the knock out phase will be published as this will be dependent on when England are playing.
 
On the 27th September 2025 it is World Cup Day and there are no fixtures so its hoped to arrange a Club Day  so that itâ€™s a day when the club can come together!
 
Please keep an eye on the website and social media for the more details and events that are scheduled to coincide with these matches.
